Articles.Content:
By far one of the most drawn out, tedious, breaky and 80% rewarding videos I've made- my Cinematic effort, with nothing but KSP, Fraps and Windows Movie Maker (shudders) I present...

The Walk

That was great! Although in places the text disappeared to quickly, as a text based youtube I know how hard it is to get the timings right, superb work anyway.

(I've made a similar cinematic:

)
I did realize the text issue, but by the time I edited it, it had racked up months of my time- I guess I focused more on finishing it; next time I'll fix that - Post editing!

I love it! Nice job!

By the way, starting at 2:00, I saw that you could overlap the Kerbal speech and the music. I'm using Movie Maker as well for a cinematic, and knowing how to overlap the sounds would be great!

Ah, yes- by far the most painstaking part of the video- If you have audio already of kerbal voices, then you finish the project with its music and all the clips and text, save it, get the finished clip and slap it into a movie maker, then post edit it to add the sounds. If you don't have the sounds, pick a strange language and faf around in movie maker with making it different speeds (done by saving it as (recommended by me only) a youtube clip, then getting another MM up and putting the saved clip in there, change stuff, then save as audio clip)

Ah, yes- by far the most painstaking part of the video- If you have audio already of kerbal voices, then you finish the project with its music and all the clips and text, save it, get the finished clip and slap it into a movie maker, then post edit it to add the sounds. If you don't have the sounds, pick a strange language and faf around in movie maker with making it different speeds (done by saving it as (recommended by me only) a youtube clip, then getting another MM up and putting the saved clip in there, change stuff, then save as audio clip)

Thanks so much!
